trans-unit.source: <properties pageTitle="Azure RemoteApp image requirements" description="Learn about the requirements for creating images to be used with Azure RemoteApp" services="remoteapp" documentationCenter="" authors="lizap" manager="mbaldwin" />
trans-unit.target: <properties pageTitle="Azure RemoteApp image requirements" description="Learn about the requirements for creating images to be used with Azure RemoteApp" services="remoteapp" documentationCenter="" authors="lizap" manager="mbaldwin" />

trans-unit.source: <tags ms.service="remoteapp" ms.workload="compute" ms.tgt_pltfrm="na" ms.devlang="na" ms.topic="article" ms.date="08/12/2015" ms.author="elizapo" />
trans-unit.target: <tags ms.service="remoteapp" ms.workload="compute" ms.tgt_pltfrm="na" ms.devlang="na" ms.topic="article" ms.date="08/12/2015" ms.author="elizapo" />

trans-unit.source: Azure RemoteApp uses a Windows Server 2012 R2 image to host all the programs that you want to share with your users.
trans-unit.target: Azure RemoteApp uses a Windows Server 2012 R2 image to host all the programs that you want to share with your users.

trans-unit.source: To create a custom image, you can start with an existing image or <linkText>create a new one</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To create a custom image, you can start with an existing image or <linkText>create a new one</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Did you know that your Azure RemoteApp subscription gives you access to a Windows Server 2012 R2 image in the Azure VM gallery that you can use to create your own template image?
trans-unit.target: Did you know that your Azure RemoteApp subscription gives you access to a Windows Server 2012 R2 image in the Azure VM gallery that you can use to create your own template image?

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Check it out</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Check it out</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The requirements for the image that can be uploaded for use with Azure RemoteApp are:
trans-unit.target: The requirements for the image that can be uploaded for use with Azure RemoteApp are:

trans-unit.source: Custom applications don’t store data locally on the image.
trans-unit.target: Custom applications don’t store data locally on the image.

trans-unit.source: These images are stateless and should only contain applications.
trans-unit.target: These images are stateless and should only contain applications.

trans-unit.source: The image does not contain data that can be lost.
trans-unit.target: The image does not contain data that can be lost.

trans-unit.source: The image size should be a multiple of MBs.
trans-unit.target: The image size should be a multiple of MBs.

trans-unit.source: If you try to upload an image that is not an exact multiple, the upload will fail.
trans-unit.target: If you try to upload an image that is not an exact multiple, the upload will fail.

trans-unit.source: The image size must be 127 GB or smaller.
trans-unit.target: The image size must be 127 GB or smaller.

trans-unit.source: It must be on a VHD file (VHDX files are not currently supported).
trans-unit.target: It must be on a VHD file (VHDX files are not currently supported).

trans-unit.source: The VHD must not be a generation 2 virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The VHD must not be a generation 2 virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The VHD can be either fixed-size or dynamically expanding.
trans-unit.target: The VHD can be either fixed-size or dynamically expanding.

trans-unit.source: A dynamically expanding VHD is recommended because it takes less time to upload to Azure than a fixed-size VHD file.
trans-unit.target: A dynamically expanding VHD is recommended because it takes less time to upload to Azure than a fixed-size VHD file.

trans-unit.source: The disk must be initialized using the Master Boot Record (MBR) partitioning style.
trans-unit.target: The disk must be initialized using the Master Boot Record (MBR) partitioning style.

trans-unit.source: The GUID partition table (GPT) partition style is not supported.
trans-unit.target: The GUID partition table (GPT) partition style is not supported.

trans-unit.source: The VHD must contain a single installation of Windows Server 2012 R2.
trans-unit.target: The VHD must contain a single installation of Windows Server 2012 R2.

trans-unit.source: It can contain multiple volumes, but only one that contains an installation of Windows.
trans-unit.target: It can contain multiple volumes, but only one that contains an installation of Windows.

trans-unit.source: The Remote Desktop Session Host (RDSH) role and the Desktop Experience feature must be installed.
trans-unit.target: The Remote Desktop Session Host (RDSH) role and the Desktop Experience feature must be installed.

trans-unit.source: The Remote Desktop Connection Broker role must not be installed.
trans-unit.target: The Remote Desktop Connection Broker role must not be installed.

trans-unit.source: The Encrypting File System (EFS) must be disabled.
trans-unit.target: The Encrypting File System (EFS) must be disabled.

trans-unit.source: The image must be SYSPREPed using the parameters /oobe /generalize /shutdown (DO NOT use the /mode:vm parameter).
trans-unit.target: The image must be SYSPREPed using the parameters /oobe /generalize /shutdown (DO NOT use the /mode:vm parameter).

trans-unit.source: Uploading your VHD from a snapshot chain is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Uploading your VHD from a snapshot chain is not supported.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Create an Azure RemoteApp image</linkText><title></title> for more information about creating images for Azure RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Create an Azure RemoteApp image</linkText><title></title> for more information about creating images for Azure RemoteApp.
